text: I'm more Lando Scott cowling I'm a
principal Technical Evangelist with the
executive engagement program at AWS and
I work with large organizations to
accelerate their journey into the cloud
and onto AWS the clouds democratizes
security technology to everybody so the
biggest banks down to the smallest
organizations can have access to the
best technology that's out there but try
to replicate that yourself on-premise is
hard if not impossible to do and
certainly would cost a significant
amount more than if you did it with AWS
so the kind of customers that benefit
from using AWS security are the
customers that could just be starting
out like startups but equally could be
large established enterprises that want
to move their infrastructure to the
clouds we have small organizations like
slack who are built in a cloud as well
as larger organizations with really
sensitive workloads like NASA who both
run on AWS
because the security that's available to
each type of organization is the same
whether you're small or whether you're
large you have access to the best
technology all that so for new customers
to keep security as a focus in their
organization's they need to build a
culture of security they need to take
security seriously that's often a
top-down culture led by the board but
equally it's got to be supported by the
right technology and the ease of use of
technology is important so use security
tools that you can gain access to
quickly and effectively inside your
business but also support them with the
right people so have a security team
have a process that supports the team
and also be prepared to react when
something goes wrong your business will
be much more secure in the cloud with
AWS each parties responsible for
security on AWS by using a model we call
the shared responsibility model and that
basically means that AWS is responsible
for the security of the cloud the
infrastructure at the underlying
technology but the customer is
responsible for security in the cloud so
their applications their data their
operating systems and how they use AWS
and by keeping that differentiation
clear customers understand where their
responsibility starts and finishes and
AWS provides an infrastructure to
support that AWS strengthens your
compliance effort by making it much
easier for you to adhere to your own
internal or even external regulatory
requirements the security available to
you in AWS is far superior to the
would be possible on-premise and also
it's easy to use so you can roll our
security protections you can respond to
compliance incidents really quickly and
really easily to do the same on premise
would be probably cost prohibitive the
benefits of cloud security are threefold
cost scale and compliance deploying an
enterprise-grade security infrastructure
in the cloud is far easier and cheaper
than on premise
scaling that infrastructure into new
projects or addressing new threats is
also easier in the cloud an AWS responds
quickly and dynamically to any new
challenge and thirdly addressing their
own internal or external compliance
requirements is very simple and very
easy to do in the cloud you're adopting
AWS is security certification so you can
be confident the infrastructure will
support whatever your project requires
[Music]
